update.description:
This builds on top of ~~pull request #62~~

I call it advanced settings because all the plugin is providing is a direct interface to the parameters exposed by Ignition Rendering. A more intuitive user interface would involve more mouse interaction, like right-clicking the node to be followed through the eyes of the camera.

There are detailed instructions on the animated box example plugin README.

![tracking.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2345997651-tracking.gif)
update.title: Camera tracking - advanced settings

content.raw: How do you feel about declining this PR? We can revisit this later with qtquick.
content.html: How do you feel about declining this PR? We can revisit this later with qtquick.

content.raw: @nkoenig , just synced this with default and it still works like it used to. Not sure if we want to merge this first version like this or try to improve the usability. It would be nice to list more friedly names on the camera and target dropdowns, to click the scene to pick the node to follow, etc. I think this is a good first pass and we can add other functionality later.
content.html: @nkoenig , just synced this with default and it still works like it used to. Not sure if we want to merge this first version like this or try to improve the usability. It would be nice to list more friedly names on the camera and target dropdowns, to click the scene to pick the node to follow, etc. I think this is a good first pass and we can add other functionality later.

content.raw: maybe because I'm using a catkin workspace. But weird I wonder how it's able to find the header without the include dirs.
content.html: maybe because I'm using a catkin workspace. But weird I wonder how it's able to find the header without the include dirs.

content.raw: humm interesting. The reason I commented it out is that for me it *didn't* build if that was there. All examples are being build by CI too. I wonder what's the difference in the setup.
content.html: humm interesting. The reason I commented it out is that for me it didn't build if that was there. All examples are being build by CI too. I wonder what's the difference in the setup.

content.raw: mm I am getting a compile error about missing `ignition/gui/qt.h` if this is removed, otherwise it builds fine if `${IGNITION-GUI_INCLUDE_DIRS}` is present
content.html: mm I am getting a compile error about missing ignition/gui/qt.h if this is removed, otherwise it builds fine if ${IGNITION-GUI_INCLUDE_DIRS} is present
